body: /// <returns>${2:Type and description of the returned object.}</returns>
comment.description: A C# comment with description, parameters, return, and example.

<c>.description: For small inline code fragments. For multiple lines of code, use <code>.

<code>.description: Used to set lines of source code or program output in a distinct font. For small inline code, use <c>.

<example>.description: Allows example code within a comment, specifying how a method or other member might be used.

<exception>.description: Documents exceptions a method can throw. `cref` is the fully qualified exception type.

<include>.description: Includes documentation from an external XML document. Self-closing tag.

<list>.description: Creates a list or table of items. Optional <listheader> blocks for table or definition lists.

<para>.description: Adds a paragraph. Typically used inside other tags (<summary>, <returns>, etc.).

<param>.description: Documents a parameter of a method, constructor, or indexer.

<paramref>.description: Highlights a parameter name in the generated documentation.

<permission>.description: Documents the security accessibility of a member.

<remarks>.description: Specifies additional information about a type or member.

body: <returns>${1:Type and description of the returned object.}$0</returns>
<returns>.description: Documents the return value of a method.

<see>.description: Creates an inline link to another member. Use <seealso> for references in a See Also section.

<seealso>.description: Creates a link for the See Also section. Use <see> for inline references.

<summary>.description: Describes a type or a member of a type. Use <remarks> for additional details.

<typeparam>.description: Describes a type parameter for a generic type or method.

<typeparamref>.description: Highlights a type parameter name in the generated documentation.

<value>.description: Describes a property in the documentation.
